section_purpose: To outline the limitations of G4SATBench and propose future research directions for improving GNN-based SAT solving.
key_points: G4SATBench focuses on standalone neural SAT solvers and excludes neural-guided SAT solvers that integrate GNNs with search-based SAT solvers.
The instances in G4SATBench are smaller than real-world applications, limiting the scalability of GNN models alone.
GNNs show efficacy in unsat-core prediction, suggesting promising integration with modern SAT solvers to scale to real-world instances.
The benchmark does not consider domain-specific GNN models tailored to problems like Circuit SAT, which could improve performance in specialized instances.
Current GNN-based SAT solvers are static and have limited ability to capture the CDCL heuristic; dynamic GNN models are proposed as a future direction.
dependencies: Section 3: Preliminaries for background on SAT solving and GNNs
Section 4: G4SATBench for benchmark details and graph representations (LCG* and VCG*)
Section 5: Benchmarking Evaluation for tasks like unsat-core prediction
Understanding of CDCL heuristic from related sections or prior knowledge
Knowledge of neural-guided SAT solvers and domain-specific GNN models
reproducibility_notes: Future work should address scaling instances to real-world sizes for practical application.
Explore techniques to integrate GNNs with search-based SAT solvers for neural-guided approaches.
Investigate domain-specific GNN models for problems like Circuit SAT to enhance performance.
Develop dynamic GNN models capable of learning the CDCL heuristic to improve SAT solving accuracy.
